title: Melissa McCarthy shares sweet throwback photo with her husband to commemorate 14th anniversary
text:
They're one of the few Hollywood couples that defy the odds.

Melissa McCarthy took to social media to commemorate her 14th wedding anniversary with husband Ben Falcone with a sweet throwback snap on Tuesday.

Long term celebrity marriages are few and far between in tinsel town but the pair managed to make it work in love, life and work.

Milestone: Melissa McCarthy took to social media to commemorate her 14th wedding anniversary with husband Ben Falcone with a sweet throwback snap on Tuesday

'These two babies had no idea that 14 years later they’d still be together,' the Bridesmaids star wrote on social media.

'Lucky,' she added with an emoji of a four leaf clover.

The black and white shot appeared to be a snap of a framed photo of the couple, who looked years younger, with bright smiles on their faces.

On her Instagram story, the comedienne also shared some creepy shots of her very own Melissa McCarthy puppet and joked that she should have given it to Ben as an anniversary present.

'These two babies had no idea that 14 years later they’d still be together. Lucky,' Melissa wroet with an emoji of a four leaf clover

Hysterical: On her Instagram story, the comedienne also shared some creepy shots of her very own Melissa McCarthy puppet and joked that she should have given it to Ben as an anniversary present

Adding in jest: 'What a missed opportunity.'

The 49-year-old Emmy winner and her actor/filmmaker husband tied the knot in 2005 after dating for a longtime prior.

Melissa and Ben have two daughters together, Vivian, born in May 2007, and Georgette, born in March 2010.

While starring on Gilmore Girls, McCarthy's pregnancy with Vivian was written in as a plot point on the show.

Defying the odds: The 49-year-old Emmy winner and her actor/filmmaker husband tied the knot in 2005 after dating for a longtime prior

In addition to a successful marriage, the couple also created their own production company in 2013, called On the Day Productions. Their first project was Tammy, which unsurprisingly starred the actress as the titular character.

Falcone often makes cameo appearances in his wife's films, most famously as Air Marshal Jon in her breakout Bridesmaids role.

Even their daughters get in on the family business and were both featured in McCarthy's 2016 comedy The Boss.

Home and work: In addition to a successful marriage, the couple also created their own production company in 2013, called On the Day Productions

The actress is rumored to be slithering into the role of Ursula the sea witch in Disney's live action version of The Little Mermaid.

The highly-anticipated aquatic tale is in the midst of casting. Hamilton star Daveed Diggs is currently in talks to voice Sebastian the crab while actress and Javier Bardem is in talks to play King Triton.

Awkwafina and Jacob Tremblay have also been announced, respectively voicing Scuttle and Flounder, while singer Halle Bailey nabbed the lead role of Ariel.

Harry Styles reportedly turned down the role of Prince Eric and now Cameron Cuffe and Jonah Hauer-King are vying for the gig.
